p: The major class compounds were the oxygenated monoterpenes which represents 71.4%, 63.0%, and 51.0% of all compounds detected in E. cardamomum, A. corrorima and A. subulatum essential oils, respectively. This family is dominated by 1,8-cineole where its maximum percentage was observed in the green cardamom (55.4%), followed by the Ethiopian cardamom (51.8) and the black cardamom (41.7).
